sentences.english: Served with Chinese daily soup, seasonal vegetable, fruit and green tea.
sentences.chinese: 本帮糖醋排骨饭配以中式老火汤，时蔬，水果及绿茶。

sentences.english: The cucumbers which did not return green in the experiment were made into sauced or sour and sweet cucumber.
sentences.chinese: 并把不能复绿的原料加工成酱香黄瓜和糖醋黄瓜。

sentences.english: Lastly bring sauce and spareribs to the boil reducing sauce by half. Serve hot with vegetable rice.
sentences.chinese: 最后把糖醋汁及腩排煮至浓稠，与菜饭同吃。

sentences.english: Would you like to go to the China Hotel for dinner ? They serve excellent sour and sweet pork steak .
sentences.chinese: 你想到中国饭店吃晚餐吗？他们的糖醋排骨棒极了。

sentences.english: Yeah, the sweet and sour fish here is delicious.
sentences.chinese: 喜欢，这里的糖醋鱼真好吃。

sentences.english: Sour-sweet fish agreed very well with him.
Sour-sweet fish agreed very well with him.
Let's order sweet and sour pork.
sentences.chinese: 让我们点一份糖醋排骨。

sentences.english: Theyare sweet and sour pork, almond junket, shrimp omelet and Chickeninsweet and sour sauce.
sentences.chinese: 茉莉点了糖醋排骨，杏仁豆腐，虾仁煎蛋和糖醋鸡块。

sentences.english: Theyare sweet and sour pork, almond junket, shrimp omelet and Chickeninsweet and sour sauce.
sentences.chinese: 茉莉点了糖醋排骨，杏仁豆腐，虾仁煎蛋和糖醋鸡块。

sentences.english: I would recommend the Sweet and Sour Spareribs if you like spareribs dishes.
sentences.chinese: 如果您喜欢排骨的话，我建议您不妨来个糖醋排骨。

sentences.english: The spareribs in sweet-sour sauce was so tender that it melted in my mouth.
sentences.chinese: 这糖醋排骨真嫩，吃起来好像不用嚼似的。

sentences.english: A truly authentic Sweet and Sour Carp must come from the Yellow River.
sentences.chinese: 正宗的糖醋鲤鱼必须打捞自黄河。

sentences.english: Sweet-and-sour salmon now regularly croon in sub-Saharan streets.
sentences.chinese: 糖醋鱼现在倒经常会在撒哈拉以南的街道上出现。

sentences.english: Generally speaking, I like Chinese food, especially sweet and sour stuff.
sentences.chinese: 总的来说，我喜欢中国食物，特别是糖醋的东西。

sentences.english: It sounds like no sweet-and-sour chicken for dinner.
sentences.chinese: 它听起来好像晚餐没有糖醋鸡可吃。

definition: Sichuan poached sliced fish in hot chili oil
mapo tofu/stir-fried beancurd in chili sauce

yuxiang, a seasoning of Chinese cuisine that typically contains garlic, scallions, ginger, sugar, salt, chili peppers etc (Although "yuxiang" literally means "fish fragrance", it contains no seafood.)
to stir-fry with oil only (no addition of water)
